patchNotes.title: Talent Rework

general.developerCommentary: Gul'dan <vanilla, abilities, basic, 1> currently has a problem..depending on how you build Gul'dan <vanilla, abilities, basic, 1> becomes your priority skill by far or the useless one and with the other changes i propose on the <vanilla, abilities, basic, 1> aspect one thing is prevalent..Without the extra cast range there's almost no incentive to use it.

patchNotes.developerCommentary: I like Gul'dan's gameplay and how he has developed in various aspects, but just because I like something doesn't mean it's solid. Currently, he faces two serious problems: one where one of his ultimates is basically losing a talent by picking it, and the other is that his talents have been molded into a funnel shape. What I mean is that there is little room for variability in Gul'dan's talents, especially if you choose to go for the <vanilla, abilities, basic, 1> build. What I initially thought could be something simple, I realized how difficult it is to change his talents without altering his entire structure and completely changing how Gul'dan should choose his talents, since the talents themselves are not necessarily bad or uncreative and with that i will probally kill some builds and i will instead make it a more all-rounded mage to preserve something i really like on Heroes of the Storm talent tree system and that's the possibility of mixing builds.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 1, 1>

texts.text: Changed functionality: <modified, abilities, basic, 1> reduces the target self-heal and regeneration effects by 75% while it's active.
subtexts: For complete context, it won't reduce healing from other heroes. For example Dehaka essence or adaptation healing will be cut but receiving healing from a Healer will work normally.

changes.developerCommentary: I am not a big fan of reducing Gul'dan skills cost but rather give him more talents on the complete build that could sustain it's skill so instead in changing it for a situational talent.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 1, 0>

texts.text: Additional functionality: Hitting <modified, abilities, basic, 2> affected targets with <modified, abilities, basic, 0> restores Gul'dan life by 22.5 this bonus is increased to 90 on heroes

changes.developerCommentary: <modified, abilities, basic, 2> is a high cost skill that Gul'dan players should take a little more care to use BUT i wanted to increase interactions between <modified, abilities, basic, 2> and the rest of the Kit. Also i wanted to provide some 'more' to the pursuit of flame as it's not very popular for being a little dull

changes.name: New talent: Consume life

texts.text: Quest: Killing troops increase Gul'dan maximun health points by 0.3% up to 20%
Reward: If Consume life is fully charged it can be activated while dead to immediately respawn at the Hall of Storms, but must be charged again.

changes.developerCommentary: I wanted to make something related to the Vanilla Dark Bargain effect but i disliked increasing respawn time the way it is..on counterpart the Malthael No One Can Stop Death gives a better control of it

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 1, 2>
changes.developerCommentary: With how i want to bring the level one talents there's not much space for Echoed <modified, abilities, basic, 2> here

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 13, 1>
changes.developerCommentary: I want to make players choose one <modified, abilities, basic, 1> bonus instead of building <modified, abilities, basic, 1>, one of the things that make <vanilla, talents, 13, 1> is strong is the combination with <vanilla, talents, 7, 1>

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 7, 1>
changes.developerCommentary: I want to make players choose one <modified, abilities, basic, 1> bonus instead of building <modified, abilities, basic, 1>

changes.name: New talent: Drain power

texts.text: <modified, abilities, basic, 1> will steal 7.5% spell power per second if used on <modified, abilities, basic, 2> affected enemies, Gul'dan will retain the spell power for 4 seconds after stop draining

changes.developerCommentary: Gul'dan is well known for drain vital essence and i think that can be transferred to spell power

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 4, 0>, <vanilla, talents, 4, 1>, <vanilla, talents, 4, 2>
changes.developerCommentary: I mixed it with <vanilla, talents, 16, 2> to bring true usability for it and i also want to bring <modified, abilities, basic, 1> talents all to this tier

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 7, 1>
changes.developerCommentary: I don't like the talent unavariability that chupacabra talents bring so i am focusing their power spike to level 4

changes.name: Darkness within

texts.text: Changed functionality: Dealing 600 (+4% per level) damage to enemy Heroes causes the next cast of <modified, abilities, trait, 0> to cost no Health and increases the mana restored to 60%.

changes.developerCommentary: I want Hungry for power and Drain power to be the only ways to obtain more spellpower so instead i am bringing this talent for a sustain.

changes.name: <vanilla, abilities, heroic, 1>

texts.text: <vanilla, abilities, heroic, 1> will now start at a 3.0 radius and will be gradually increasing it up to 9 on the 5 second mark. Has 50% reduced damage against structures now
subtexts: This won't change the meteor spawn rate it will just concentrate the damage at the beginning at a smaller area.

changes.developerCommentary: My initial idea was to make <vanilla, abilities, heroic, 1> have a smaller radius since the beginning and make it have charges but that would make it too similar on Jaina Blizzard and after thinking a little RoD greatest problem was the uncertainty of it's effect as it one of the few skills that are affected by luck on Heroes of the storm. End result was not go away from the similarity to Blizzard but make it on a unique way.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 13, 2>

texts.text: Changed functionality: Activate to consume a enemy or allied hero body to absorb their maximum health points, the extra health granted will decay over 15 seconds
subtexts: This will consume their maximum health points after death. So if you guldan has 3000hp and kill a maximum souls Diablo that had 8k life by losing his souls lets say he has 6k life now then you will be granted 6k health points.
This will literally consume de corpse so Auriel Ressurect can't be used on the consumed target

changes.developerCommentary: Gul'dan is known for trying increase his own lifespan be it by changing bodies or draining life essence, it's totally on lore for him doing it.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 13, 1>
changes.developerCommentary: You alredy saw my deeds and also, i dislike healthstone and harvest life on the same tier as they achieve the same goal with the only difference that <modified, abilities, basic, 1> was gatekeeped by picking other talents

changes.name: New: Drain hope

texts.text: Activate to channel for 1.5 second, and then instantly teleport and cast <modified, abilities, basic, 1> on all enemies in range.
subtexts: 7.0 range | Same as Malfurion 20 astral Communion

texts.text: Passive: Enemies that take full <modified, abilities, basic, 1> take additional 8% damage on the end

changes.developerCommentary: Inspired by Fiddlesticks ultimate i wanted to create some way to make a ultra power move with <modified, abilities, basic, 1> and make the Chupacabra build a little different.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 16, 2>
changes.developerCommentary: You alredy saw my deeds but i always felt that was a little strange a talent that had little appeal on gameplay variability compared to the other talents appear on level 16. <vanilla, talents, 16, 0> requires consistent gameplay and Ruinous Affliction timed <modified, abilities, basic, 2>s but Darkness Within just require damaging to provide damage FOR THAT TIER i kinda dislike the bladness.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 1, 2>
changes.developerCommentary: This is a strong level 16 contender and with the new level 20 talent it becomes more willing to be picked.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 16, 1>
changes.developerCommentary: We are adding a little buff to him and pushing echoed <modified, abilities, basic, 2> to level 16 to better balance things

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 16, 1>

texts.text: Additional functionality: Enemy heroes hit by <modified, abilities, basic, 2> are marked by Gul'dan envy, stealing all healing received by 40% for 6 seconds.
subtexts: Receiving extra stacks resets the duration
This is not reduced healing effect is literally healing stealing

changes.developerCommentary: I like this talent but with how i wanted to rework it there wasn't much space for it BUT i also wanted something that would make Gul'dan steal healing so WE GOT AN OPPORTUNITY
